title: A nonabelian circle method
authors:
Nuno Arala, Jayce R. Getz, Jiaqi Hou, Chun-Hsien Hsu, Huajie Li, and
  Victor Y. Wang
abstract:
We count integral quaternion zeros of $\gamma_1^2 \pm \dots \pm \gamma_n^2$,
giving an asymptotic when $n\ge 9$, and a likely near-optimal bound when $n=8$.
To do so, we introduce a new, nonabelian delta symbol method, which is of
independent interest. Our asymptotic at height $X$ takes the form $cX^{4n-8} +
O(X^{3n+\varepsilon})$ for suitable $c \in \mathbb{C}$ and any $\varepsilon>0.$
We construct special subvarieties implying that, in general, $3n+\varepsilon$
can be at best improved to $3n-2.$
